text: Body and Soul is an album by the Al Cohn and Zoot Sims recorded in 1973 for the Muse label.Al CohnCatalog, accessed April 21, 2017Zoot Sims Catalog, accessed April 21, 2017Muse LP series discography: 5000 to 5049, accessed April 21, 2017Fitzgerald, M. & Zeigler F. Muse Records Listing, accessed April 21, 2017 == Reception == The Allmusic review by Scott Yanow stated "Cohn and Sims still had very complementary sounds and personalities, so their collaboration on Body and Soul (Muse) holds its own against their earlier dates. ... This is pleasing and frequently lyrical music". On All About Jazz Joel Roberts called it "a thoroughly enjoyable, low-key blowing session featuring the two tenor titans backed by an excellent veteran rhythm section" and noted "Cohn and Sims display that rare musical affinity that only years of playing together can breed".Roberts, J. All About Jazz Review, accessed April 21, 2017 == Track listing == # "Doodle Oodle" (Billy Byers) – 6:54 # "Emily" (Johnny Mandel, Johnny Mercer) – 7:19 # "Samba Medley: Recado Bossa Nova/The Girl from Ipanema/One Note Samba" (Djalma Ferreira/Antônio Carlos Jobim/Jobim) – 7:59 # "Mama Flossie" (Al Cohn) – 5:43 # "Body and Soul" (Johnny Green, Frank Eyton, Edward Heyman, Robert Sour) – 5:38 # "Jean" (Rod McKuen) – 6:03 # "Blue Hodge" (Gary McFarland) – 7:03 == Personnel == * Al Cohn – tenor saxophone * Zoot Sims – tenor saxophone, soprano saxophone * Jaki Byard – piano * George Duvivier – bass * Mel Lewis – drums == References == Category:1974 albums Category:Muse Records albums Category:Al Cohn albums Category:Zoot Sims albums Category:Albums produced by Don Schlitten
title: Body and Soul (Al Cohn & Zoot Sims album)
